title: Robotics Seed fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Seed-stage robotics metrics focus on real-world performance, not lab capabilities. Investors evaluate task success rates in production conditions, deployment scalability, and customer economics. These benchmarks demonstrate whether your robot actually works outside the lab. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Task Success Rate
metrics.note: Percentage of tasks completed without human intervention in real deployments. Must show improvement trajectory toward 95%+.

metrics.label: Interventions Per Shift
metrics.note: Human interventions required during operation. Categorize by type: navigation, manipulation, edge cases.

metrics.label: Autonomous Runtime
metrics.note: Hours of operation without required intervention. Demonstrates system reliability and robustness.

metrics.label: Deployment Time
metrics.note: Time from arrival to production operation. Shows deployment process maturity and scalability potential.

metrics.label: Pilot Count
metrics.note: Customer pilot deployments in production environments. Quality and diversity of pilots matter.

metrics.label: Pilot Runtime Hours
metrics.note: Cumulative runtime across all pilots. Demonstrates real-world validation and data for improvement.

metrics.label: Customer ROI Payback
metrics.note: Time for customer to recover robot investment. Based on validated labor savings and productivity gains.

metrics.label: Hardware Cost
metrics.note: Robot hardware cost target at production volume. Must support customer ROI payback timeline.

metrics.label: Team Size
metrics.note: Core team covering mechanical, software, perception, and deployment. Field deployment experience is critical.

metrics.label: Capital Raised
metrics.note: Robotics seed rounds tend larger given hardware and deployment costs. May include non-dilutive grants.
